article.Heading: Tax officials concerned over increase in assessees not filed returns under GST
article.Summary: The key concern of the government has been that the tax base has been expanding but that is not getting reflected in the return being filed and people are not concerned about the fact that they have to pay penalty.
article.Body:
The month-on-month decline in GST returns filed has sent tax officials into a tizzy as the gap of filers vs non-filers has widened from 21 lakh not having filed GST returns for July to now over 30 lakh not having filed so far for August.

The key concern of the government has been that the tax base has been expanding but that is not getting reflected in the returns being filed and people are not concerned about the fact that they have to pay penalty.

The number of GST returns filed for July improved to 51 lakh against the estimated 59.59 lakh and for the month of August 38.38 lakh GST returns have been filed till August 29 against the estimated 68.20 lakh.

The government expects that system will take 2-3 months to settle down and is confident that the GST filing will go up. They expect the December GST revenues will go up by Rs 100,000 crore which is much higher than the internal Budget estimates.

The key issue for the government in the next 2-3 months is to enable people to file tax returns.
